means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 邦奇绰号，驼背，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“驼背，隆起”(bump,swelling)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"捆，包"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: pack, package, packet, parcel, bunch, bundle
means: pack ： 指专为背负而包扎的包裹，也指驮物等。
package ： 指包装整齐严密的包裹或一包、一捆、一盒东西。
packet ： 一般指小件行李、邮包、还可指更小一些的包。
parcel ： 着重指邮包，也指将东西扎成小包或不太大的包。
bunch ： 指有规则地把同类东西固定在一起。
bundle ： 指多件东西被捆扎在一起。

sentence.Network_en: Joseph watched a shady-looking bunch playing cards aboard a Mississippi steamer.
sentence.Network_cn: 约瑟夫看到一群可疑的人在密西西比河的一艘轮船上打牌。

sentence.Network_en: We don't want to look like a bunch of cowboys.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们不想看上去像一帮奸商。

sentence.Network_en: They're just a bunch of leeches cadging off others!
sentence.Network_cn: 他们只不过是一帮伸手向人要这要那的寄生虫！

phrase.cizu_name: the best (或 the pick) of the bunch

jx.jx_en_mean: the best of a particular group

jx.jx_cn_mean: (讽， 主 英)多谢，非常感谢

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : of unknown origin

entry.def: A bunch of people is a group of people who share one or more characteristics or who are doing something together.

example.ex: My neighbours are a bunch of busybodies...
example.tran: 我的邻居们是一群爱管闲事的人。

example.ex: We were a pretty inexperienced bunch of people really...
example.tran: 我们事实上是一些相当没有经验的人。

entry.def: A bunch of flowers is a number of flowers with their stalks held or tied together.

example.ex: He had left a huge bunch of flowers in her hotel room.
example.tran: 他在她宾馆房间里留下了一大束花。

entry.def: A bunch of bananas or grapes is a group of them growing on the same stem.

example.ex: Lili had fallen asleep clutching a fat bunch of grapes.
example.tran: 莉莉手里抓着一大串葡萄睡着了。

entry.def: A bunch of keys is a set of keys kept together on a metal ring.

example.ex: George took out a bunch of keys and went to work on the complicated lock.
example.tran: 乔治掏出一串钥匙，上前去鼓捣那把结构复杂的锁。

entry.def: A bunch of things is a number of things, especially a large number.

example.ex: We did a bunch of songs together.
example.tran: 我们一起唱了很多首歌。

entry.def: If a girl has her hair in bunches, it is parted down the middle and tied on each side of her head.
If clothing bunches around a part of your body, it forms a set of creases around it.

example.ex: She clutches the sides of her skirt until it bunches around her waist.
example.tran: 她捏着裙子的两侧，直到裙子在她腰部打起了褶。

entry.tran: 同类中最好的；出类拔萃者；精华
entry.def: If you say someone or something is the best of the bunch or the pick of the bunch, you mean they are the best of a group of people or things.

example.ex: I watched every game of the World Cup and Craig was the pick of the bunch.
example.tran: 我观看了世界杯的每场比赛，克雷格是表现最出色的。

means.word_mean: 1. a grouping of a number of similar things;

sentences.sentence: "he still hangs out with the same crowd"
"The frightened children bunched together in the corner of the classroom"

means.word_mean: 2. gather or cause to gather into a cluster;

sentences.sentence: "She bunched her fingers into a fist"
"The students bunched up at the registration desk"

example.en: He must have paid a bunch for that mink.
example.zh: 买那件轺皮大衣他准破费了不少。

Sentence.sentence: Anyone who has patted a dog, stroked a cat, sat under a tree with a pint of beer, given or received a bunch of flowers or chosen to walk through the park on a nice day, understands that.

sentences.en: I received a bunch of flowers yesterday.
sentences.cn: 昨天我收到了一束鲜花。

sentences.en: I don't like any of them much, but he's the best of the bunch.
sentences.cn: 这帮人我谁也不喜欢, 但他还算是其中最好的呢。

sentences.en: A bunch of girls was[were] sitting on the grass.
Vehicles often bunches on the big highways.
sentences.cn: 在干线公路上, 交通往往十分拥挤。

sentences.en: He bunched the flowers and sold them.

jushi.english: A bunch of girls was〔were〕 sitting on the grass.
My students are quite a nice bunch.
jushi.chinese: 我的学生确是一群好孩子。

jushi.english: I received a bunch of flowers yesterday.
jushi.chinese: 昨天我收到了一束鲜花。
